items.title: Federal Court Blocks Texas’ Republican-Friendly Congressional Map
items.summary: The move by a three-judge panel dealt a blow to efforts by Texas Republicans and President Trump to flip Democratic seats in the state.

items.title: Texas Governor Declares Muslim Civil Rights Group a ‘Terrorist Organization’
items.summary: Gov. Greg Abbott said the state could now take steps to shut down the Council on American-Islamic Relations. The group said the declaration had no basis in fact or law.

items.title: Faster Communication Could Have Saved Bridge Workers’ Lives, Safety Agency Says
items.summary: At a hearing on the crash that led to the collapse of the Key Bridge in Baltimore, investigators said the six construction workers might have survived if the police had warned them in time.

items.title: Trump Library Foundation Expects to Raise $50 Million This Year
items.summary: President Trump is raising money far faster than his predecessors, extracting tens of millions of dollars in pledged donations from media companies he has sued.

items.title: Trump Team Calls Maduro a ‘Cartel’ Boss. That Word Doesn’t Mean What You Think.
items.summary: Venezuelans coined a figure of speech for the phenomenon of generals corrupted by drug money: “Cartel de los Soles.” Then the United States started talking about it as a literal organization.

items.title: Border Patrol Expands North Carolina Operations to More Liberal Cities
items.summary: Agents were active in the Raleigh area on Tuesday, though the scope of the immigration crackdown in the state’s Research Triangle region was not immediately clear.

items.title: House begins debate on release of Epstein files; Mike Johnson says he’ll back release – US politics live
items.summary: <p>Move comes after Donald Trump dropped his opposition to a vote on releasing files on the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/18/house-vote-epstein-documents">Full report: House set to vote on release of Epstein documents</a></p></li><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/18/epstein-files-release-vote">Explainer: What to know about the US House vote</a></p></li><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/jul/24/what-are-jeffrey-epstein-documents-trump">Explainer: What are the Epstein files?</a></p></li></ul><p><strong>The Harvard professor and economist Larry Summers said he would be stepping back from public life after documents released by the House oversight committee revealed email exchanges between Summers and the convicted sex offender <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/jeffrey-epstein">Jeffrey Epstein</a>, who called himself Summers’ “wing man”.</strong></p><p>Politico <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2025/11/17/larry-summers-steps-back-from-public-commitments-deeply-ashamed-by-epstein-revelations-00655712">reported</a> on Monday that Summers, a former treasury secretary, expressed deep regret for past messages with Epstein.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/nov/18/house-vote-jeffrey-epstein-files-donald-trump-republicans-democrats-us-politics-live-news">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Man pours liquid on woman and sets her on fire on Chicago subway
items.summary: <p>Victim is hospitalized and suspect fled the scene following an argument on the city’s train system </p><p>A woman is currently hospitalized after being set on fire on the <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/chicago">Chicago</a> train system, according to police.</p><p>At around 9.25pm on Monday, a 26-year-old woman was riding the Chicago Transit Authority system’s Blue Line near the Clark/Lake station when she got into an argument with an approximately 45-year-old man.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/18/man-sets-woman-on-fire-chicago-subway">Continue reading...</a>
